steps.title: Assess Affordability
tasks: Calculate upfront funds and potential borrowing.
Use an affordability calculator and get an agreement in principle (AIP) for added attractiveness.

steps.title: Property Search
tasks: Research areas and find properties through estate agents and online platforms.

steps.title: Make an Offer
tasks: Determine a suitable offer and conditions.
Consider advice from forums but avoid revealing tactics publicly.

steps.title: Offer Accepted
tasks: Celebrate the milestone but remain cautious.
Be aware of gazumping and gazanging risks.

steps.title: Mortgage Search
tasks: Explore mortgage options beyond your current bank.
Use tools to find the best deals and obtain a mortgage illustration.

steps.title: Conveyancing Fees
tasks: Decide on a conveyancer for legal processes.
Ensure they are on major lenders' panels.

steps.title: Mortgage Application
tasks: Convert AIP to a full application.
Lender checks borrower and property suitability.

steps.title: Legal Searches
tasks: Solicitor conducts searches including local authority, drainage, and environmental checks.

steps.title: Stay in Touch
tasks: Communicate regularly with your solicitor.
Address any delays promptly.

steps.title: Property Survey
tasks: Choose a survey type based on property type and value.
Get quotes for potential repair work if issues are found.

steps.title: Mortgage Offer
tasks: Celebrate receiving a formal mortgage offer.
Verify accuracy and check for conditions.

steps.title: Buildings Insurance
tasks: Secure insurance after the exchange of contracts.
Ensure coverage matches the property's rebuild value.

steps.title: Completion Date
tasks: Agree on a completion date with the seller.
Be flexible to accommodate both parties.

steps.title: Exchange Contracts
tasks: Hand over the deposit to the solicitor.
Sign the contract, creating a legally-binding agreement.

steps.title: Completion
tasks: Receive a completion statement from the solicitor.
Pay outstanding fees, complete final checks, and get the keys.

questions.question: What does AIP stand for in the context of mortgage affordability?
What is the primary purpose of an affordability calculator?
options: To calculate upfront funds and potential borrowing
questions.correct_answer: To calculate upfront funds and potential borrowing

questions.question: What is the main attraction of an AIP in the home-buying process?
options: It guarantees a lower interest rate
It adds attractiveness to your offer
questions.correct_answer: It adds attractiveness to your offer

questions.question: What is the potential risk of relying solely on an AIP?
options: The actual mortgage terms may differ
questions.correct_answer: The actual mortgage terms may differ

questions.question: Where can you exclusively find properties during the property search process?
options: Through estate agents and online platforms
questions.correct_answer: Through estate agents and online platforms

questions.question: What should you avoid when researching areas for property search?
What is the primary role of estate agents in property search?
options: To assist in the buying process and negotiations
questions.correct_answer: To assist in the buying process and negotiations

options: It is the only way to find property values
It provides access to a wide range of property listings

options: Considering market conditions and property value

questions.question: What is the risk of revealing negotiation tactics publicly?
options: It speeds up the buying process
Others may use the same tactics against you
questions.correct_answer: Others may use the same tactics against you

questions.question: Why is it important to seek advice from forums when making an offer?

options: To specify terms that must be met for the offer to be valid
questions.correct_answer: To specify terms that must be met for the offer to be valid

questions.question: What is the primary emotion upon having an offer accepted?
What is the risk associated with gazumping?

Another buyer outbids and secures the property
questions.correct_answer: It guarantees a lower purchase price

questions.question: Why is it important to remain cautious after an offer is accepted?
options: There are no potential risks at this stage
Risks such as gazumping and gazanging still exist
questions.correct_answer: Risks such as gazumping and gazanging still exist

questions.question: What does "gazanging" refer to in the home-buying process?
options: A celebratory dance after an offer is accepted
The seller pulling out of the sale after accepting an offer
questions.correct_answer: A celebratory dance after an offer is accepted

options: At the beginning of the process

mortgage_steps.title: Early Repayment Charge:
tasks: Penalty for repaying or overpaying mortgage during the tie-in period.
Percentage-based (e.g., 5% in year one, 4% in year two).
Consider remortgaging after the tie-in period to avoid this fee.

mortgage_steps.title: Deeds Release Fee:
tasks: Paid to release property's title deeds to your solicitor.
Typically between £50 and £300, check original paperwork.

mortgage_steps.title: Arrangement Fee:
tasks: Covers lender's administration costs.
Ranges from £1,000 to £2,000, consider upfront payment or adding to the mortgage.

mortgage_steps.title: Booking Fee (if applicable):
tasks: Non-refundable fee to secure a fixed-rate, tracker, or discount deal.
Rare but may range from £100 to £300.

mortgage_steps.title: Valuation Fee:
tasks: Often included in remortgage packages.
If not, expect to pay £300 to £500 for property valuation.

mortgage_steps.title: Conveyancing Fee:
tasks: Legal work to remove original lender's interest and register the new lender.
Around £350, may be covered by the new lender.

mortgage_steps.title: Broker Fee (if applicable):
tasks: Charged by brokers, ranging from £300 to 1% of the loan amount.
Some brokers are fee-free; negotiate fees based on commission.

mortgage_steps.title: New Mortgage Repayments:
tasks: Use Mortgage best buys tool to benchmark rates.
Calculate exact monthly payments using a mortgage calculator.

mortgage_steps.title: Considerations:
tasks: Be cautious of low rates disguising high fees.
Check for any additional costs or fees not listed here.
Pay attention to the overall cost (fees + interest) of the mortgage.
